subject: Re: [junit] Is Junit-based testing REALLY possible for commercial software development ?
msgSnippet: ... Don t worry about being off-topic. There isn t enough traffic on this list to be concerned. ... You re welcome. Thank you for enjoying it. Please write a
messageBody:
Oisin Kim wrote:

> Finally, (and possibly a little OT) to add to this thread, I'd be very
> interested in anyone's opinion on these though (Hope you don't mind this
> hijack Frank but I think its relevant!) these are the Click your way through
> a series of web pages to perform "something" and it will be repeated for you
> by software, good for an End to End approach to testing.
>
> Not sure if it can still be classed as Unit testing though, so apologies in
> advance if this is OT.
>
> http://www.crimsonsolutions.co.uk/testing/testing-downloads.php
> http://www.pushtotest.com/Downloads/features.html

Don't worry about being off-topic. There isn't enough traffic on this
list to be concerned.

> Again, apologies if this is OT, and J.B. thanks for the JUnit Recipes book
> :)

You're welcome. Thank you for enjoying it. Please write a review!
--
J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger :: http://www.jbrains.info
Your guide to software craftsmanship
JUnit Recipes: Practical Methods for Programmer Testing
2005 Gordon Pask Award for contribution Agile Software Practice
